`$arrayConcat` will concat multiple arrays.
example:
This will return `This is a test` as it concats array 1 and 2:

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "arrayConcat",
  code: `
  $arrayConcat[ ;array1;array2]
  $createArray[array1;This is]
  $createArray[array2;a test]
  `
});
```

`$clientLeave` will make your bot leave a specific server.
example:
This will make your bot leave the current guild:

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "clientLeave",
  code: `
  $clientLeave[$guildID]
  $wait[2s]
  $sendMessage[Bye, I'm leaving!]
  `
});
```

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild which your bot shall leave.

```javascript
  `
});
```

description: `$newApplicationCmd` gets the data from application Callbacks (update and create one).
example:
```js
client.applicationCmdUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Slash command was updated!
- Name: $newApplicationCmd[name]
- ID: $newApplicationCmd[id]
- Application ID: $newApplicationCmd[applicationID]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **slash command is updated** (Modified)

description: `$newChannel` holds data of the updated channel, used in channel update, delete and create events, or else any datawill be empty.
example:
```js
client.channelCreateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    New channel has been created!
- Name: $newChannel[name]
- ID: $newChannel[id]
- <#$newChannel[id]>`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is created**.

---

```js
client.channelDeleteCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Channel has been deleted!
- Name: $oldChannel[name]
- ID: $oldChannel[id]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is deleted**.

---

```js
client.channelUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Channel has been updated!
- New name: $newChannel[name]
 - Old name: $oldChannel[name]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is updated**.

---

description: `$newEmoji` holds data for the emoji after it was updated/ deleted. (emojiUpdate and emojiDelete event)
`$newGuild` holds data for the guild after the update, might be a good idea to check partial option before accessing anyproperty. (guildUpdate event)
`$newMember` holds data for the member after the update, might be a good idea to check partial option before accessingany property. (memberUpdate event)
example:
- **Note: you need `GuildMembers` intent**

```js
client.memberUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their nickname!
- New Nickname: $newMember[nick]
 - Old Nickname: $oldMember[nick]
 
   $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their name!
- New Name: $newMember[name]
 - Old Name: $oldMember[name]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **member updates their guild nickname or discord username**

description: `$newPresence` holds data of the updated presence.
`$newRole` holds data of a role that was created, updated, or deleted. Used in role update / delete / create events,or else it won't give any data.
`$newState` holds data for the user voice state after the update (voiceStateUpdate event).
`$newUser` holds data of the updated user.
`$newVariable` gets the data from variable events.
`$oldApplicationCmd` gets the data from application Callbacks (update and delete one)
example:
```js
client.applicationCmdUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Slash command was updated!
- New Name: $newApplicationCmd[name]
 - Old Name: $oldApplicationCmd[name]
- New Description: $newApplicationCmd[description]
 - Old Description: $oldApplicationCmd[description]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **slash command is updated** (Modified)

description: `$oldChannel` holds data of the channel before it was updated, used in channel update event, or else any data will beempty
example:
```js
client.channelCreateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    New channel has been created!
- Name: $newChannel[name]
- ID: $newChannel[id]
- <#$newChannel[id]>`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is created**.

---

```js
client.channelDeleteCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Channel has been deleted!
- Name: $oldChannel[name]
- ID: $oldChannel[id]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is deleted**.

---

```js
client.channelUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    Channel has been updated!
- New name: $newChannel[name]
 - Old name: $oldChannel[name]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **channel is updated**.

---

description: `$oldEmoji` holds data for the emoji before it was updated/ deleted. (emojiUpdate and emojiDelete event)

`$oldGuild` holds data for the guild before it was updated, this is from discord cache and might be empty depending onwhether it's cached, so use partial option before attempting to access any property. (guildUpdate event)

`$oldMember` holds data for the member before it was updated, this is from discord cache and might be empty depending onwhether it's cached, so use partial option before attempting to access any property. (memberUpdate event)
example:
- **Note: You need `GuildMembers` intent**

```js
client.memberUpdateCommand({
  channel: "channelid",
  code: `
    $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their nickname!
- New Nickname: $newMember[nick]
 - Old Nickname: $oldMember[nick]
 
   $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their name!
- New Name: $newMember[name]
 - Old Name: $oldMember[name]`
});
```

- This code will execute when **member updates their guild nickname or discord username**

---

description: `$oldMessage` holds the content of the message before it was updated. (if any)
`$oldMsgData` holds data of the old message.
`$oldPresence` holds old data of the user's presence, used in update presence event, or else any data will be empty
`$oldRole` holds data of the role before it was updated, used in role update event, or else any data will be empty.
`$oldState` holds data for the user voice state before it was updated (voiceStateUpdate event).
`$oldUser` holds data of the old user, used in update user event, or else any data will be empty.
`$oldVariable` gets the data from variable Callbacks (update and delete one)

example:

```javascript
$createApplicationCommand[global;exampleslash;Simple example slash command.;true;true;slash;[{
    "name": "exampleOption",
    "description": "example slash command option",
    "required": true,
    "type": 3
}]]
```

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "exampleslash",
  type: "interaction",
  prototype: "slash",
  code: `
    $interactionReply[What a great example! You entered $slashOption[exampleOption]!]`
});
```

example:

description: `$interactionDefer` defers an Interaction of the last 15 minutes.
example:
```javascript
client.command({
  name: "exampleButton",
  type: "interaction",
  prototype: "button",
  code: `
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the second message!] 
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the first message!] 
   $interactionDefer[true]`
});
```

ephemeral.description: Visible to the command author only?

description: `$interactionDeferUpdate` defers the interaction message that will be updated.
example:
```javascript
client.command({
  name: "exampleButton",
  type: "interaction",
  prototype: "button",
  code: ` 
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the first message!]
   $interactionEdit[This is the second message!]
   $interactionDeferUpdate[true]`
});
```

ephemeral.description: Visible to the command author only?

description: `$interactionDelete` will delete a reply of an interaction.
example:
This will delete the interaction after 5 seconds.

```javascript
module.exports = [
  {
    name: "interactionDelete",
    type: "interaction",
    prototype: "button",
    code: `
  $interactionDelete
  $wait[5s]
  $interactionReply[Hello, World!;;;;everyone;false]
  `
  },
];
```

description: `$interactionEdit` will return edit an interaction.
example:
```javascript
module.exports = [
  {
    name: "interactionEdit",
    type: "interaction",
    prototype: "slash",
    code: `
  $interactionEdit[Bye, World!;;;;everyone]
  $wait[5s]
  $interactionReply[Hello, World!;;;;everyone;false]
  `
  },
];
```

`$and` will check if all given conditions are true.
example:
This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, one condition is `false`.

```js
client.command({
  name: "and",
  code: `
  $and[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: false
});
```

Another example but with it returning true would be:

This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==6.7.0` -> `true`

As you can see, all conditions are `true`.

```js
client.command({
  name: "and",
  code: `
  $and[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==6.7.0]` // returns: true
});
```

...conditions.description: The conditions you want to check.

example:
This will return the usage (defined by added properties) of the command:

- You can add anything you'd like, for example "usage" as below.
- You can use aliases or the command name to return it's information.

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "commandInfo",
  aliases: ["ci", "cmdInfo"],
  usage: "commandInfo [command]",
  code: `
  Usage: $commandInfo[ci;usage]
  `
});
```

description: `$elseif` is used to create an else statement with condition.
example:
Example usage of `$if: old` (will return "Hello" when the condition is true):

You require `$endelseif` to end the `$elseIf` statement.

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "if",
  $if: "old",
  code: `
  $if[1==2]
  Hello!
  $elseif[2==4]
  $endelseif
  $endif
  `
});
```

description: `$endelseif` is used to end an elseif statement.
example:
Example usage of `$if: old` (will return "Hello" when the condition is true):

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "if",
  $if: "old",
  code: `
  $if[1==2]
  Hello!
  $elseif[2==4]
  $endelseif
  $endif
  `
});
```

description: `$endif` is used to end an if statement.

Example usage of `$if: old` (will return "Hello" when the condition is true):

```javascript
  $if[1==1]
```

description: `$getAuditLogs` will retrieve guild audit logs according to the given arguments.
table:
| Field   | Type                                                                                              | Description                                            | Required |
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ | :------: |
| guildID | [number](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number) | The ID of a specific guild.                            |   true   |
| userID? | [number](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number) | The user who executed the action stated in audit logs. |  false   |
| limit?  | [number](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number) | The maximum of audit logs it will return.              |  false   |
| action? | [number](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number) | The action that was executed.                          |  false   |
| format? | [string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String) | The format to return the audit logs in.                |  false   |

| Format                |                                                                   |
| --------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------- |
| \{executor.username\} | Will return the username of the user who excuted the action       |
| \{executor.mention\}  | Will mention the user who executed the action                     |
| \{executor.id\}       | Will return the user ID of the user who executed the action       |
| \{executor.tag\}      | Will return the discriminator of the user who executed the action |
| \{target.id\}         | Will return the ID of the user who was the target of the action   |
| \{action\}            | Will return the action itself                                     |
| \{id\}                | Will return the action/auditlog ID                                |

description: `$if` will check a condition and return either true or false depending on the condition being true or false.
example:
This will return `That's false!` as `1` doesn't equal `2`:

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "if",
  code: `
    $if[1==2;That's true!;That's false!]
    `
});
```

This will do the exact same just different usage of `$if` by using `$if: "old"`:

```javascript
client.command({
  name: "if",
  $if: "old",
  code: `
    $if[1==2]
    That's true!
    $else
    That's false!
    $endif
    `
});
```

true.description: What to return when the condition is true.

false?.description: What to return when the condition is false.

`$or` will check if one of the given conditions is true.
example:
This will check if the two of three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, one condition is `false`.

```js
client.command({
  name: "or",
  code: `
  $or[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: true
});
```

Another example but with it returning false would be:

This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$channelId` -> `false`
2. `1!=1` -> `false`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, all conditions are `false`.

```js
client.command({
  name: "or",
  code: `
  $or[$authorId==$channelId;1!=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: false
});
```

...conditions.description: The conditions you want to check.

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild you want to check its partnership status of.

description: `$isGuildVerified` checks if the given guild is verified by Discord.

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild where you want to check its verification status of.

description: `$isHoisted` will check if a specific role is hoisted.

roleID.description: ID of the role you want to check if it's hoisted or not.

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild where you want to check if the role is hoisted or not.

description: `$isInteger` will check if the given number is an integer or not.

number.description: Number you want to check if its an number or not.

description: `$isMentionable` check if a given role is mentionable.

roleID.description: The role ID to check if it's mentionable or not.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where the role is present in.

description: `$isMentioned` checks if the query contains a mention.

query.description: Where you want to check if a user/role/channel was mentioned.

description: `$isMuted` will check if a specific user is muted within a voice channel.

userID.description: ID of the user you want to check if they're muted.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where the user is muted in.

description: `$isNumber` will check if the given argument is a number.

num.description: Argument you want to check if its a number.

description: `$isRoleEditable` will check if the role is editable.

roleID.description: ID of the role you want to check if its editable.

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild where the role exists.

description: `$isRoleManaged` will check if a certain role is managed by Discord.

roleID.description: ID of the role you want to check if it's managed by Discord or not.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where the role exists.

description: `$isSelfDeafened` is similar but not to confuse with `$isDeafen` this will check if the user deafened themselves.

userID?.description: ID of the user you want to check if they're deafened.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where they're deafened in.

description: $isSelfMuted is similar but not to confuse with `$isMuted` this will check if the user muted themselves.

userID?.description: ID of the user you want to check if they're muted.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where they're muted in.

description: `$isStreaming` will check if one user is streaming in a voice channel.

userID?.description: ID of the user you want to check if they're streaming.

guildID?.description: ID of the channel where they're streaming in.

description: `$isThread` will check if the given channel is a thread or not.

channelID?.description: ID of the channel that you want to check.

description: `$isTicket` will return either true or false depending on the channel being a ticket channel.

channelID?.description: Channel ID.

description: `$isTimeout` will check if the user is timeouted with Discord's built-in timeout feature.

guildID?.description: The ID of the guild where they're timeouted in.

userID?.description: The ID of the user that's timeouted.

description: `$isUnicodeEmoji` will check if the given emoji is an unicode emoji.
`$isUserDmEnabled` will check if the user's Direct Messages are either disabled or enabled.

userID.description: ID of the user you want to check if their dms are enabled or not.

description: `$isValidColor` will check if a given color is valid, based on regex.

color.description: The color you want to check, can be hex or decimal.

description: `$isValidHex` will check if the given hex / decimal color is valid.
`$isValidImageLink` will check if the given image link is valid.
`$isValidInvite` will check if the given invite is valid.
`$isValidLink` will check if the given link is valid.
`$isValidObject` checks if the given json is a valid object.
`$isVariableExist` checks if a given variable exists in a given table.
`$isVideoOn` checks if the given user has their video on in a voice channel.

userID?.description: ID of the user who turned video on.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild you want to check if they have their video on.

description: `$isVoice` will check if the given channel is a voice channel or not.

channelID.description: ID of the channel that you want to check if it's a Voice Channel.

description: `$isWidgetEnabled` will return either true or false depending on if the widget of the guild is enabled.
`$jsonRequest` will send a GET request to a given URL.

URL.description: URL you want to get/send data to/from

error?.description: Error to return when request fails

description: `$let` will store temporary variables which can be retrieved by `$get`.

value.description: Value of the temporary variable you want to save.

description: `$mentionType` will return the type of the mention.

content.description: The mention whose mention type will be returned.

description: `$mentioned` will return the ID of an user of the mention.

returnSelf?.description: Return the author's ID if user was not found.

description: `$mentionedChannels` will return the ID of a channel retrieved from the mention.

returnSelf?.description: Return the ID of the channel where the command was executed in when channel was not found.

description: `$mentionedChannelsCount` will return the amount of channel mentions within a message.
`$mentionedRoles` will return the ID of a role retrieved from a message.
`$mentionedRolesCount` will return the amount of role mentions within a message.
`$mentionedUsersCount` will return the amount of user mentions within a message.
`$messageExists` will check if a specific message exists.

channelID?.description: the channel id where the message is located

description: `$messageSlice` will slice a message.

from.description: Starting point where to slice the message.

description: `$nonEscape` will stop escaping special characters.

message.description: Text you don't want to be escaped.

description: `$numberSeparator` will separate numbers and make them readable.

sep?.description: Separator which will be used to separate the numbers, default: `,`.

description: `$onlyForCategories` will check if the command was executed in the category of the execution channel and return a errormessage if not.

...categoryIds.description: Categories you want to limit the command to.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed in any of the listed categories.

description: `$onlyForChannels` will check if the command was executed in one of the listed channels and return a error message ifnot.

...channelIds.description: Channels you want to limit the command to.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed in any of the listed channels.

description: `$onlyForGuilds` will check if the command was executed in one of the listed guilds and return a error message if not.

...guildIds.description: Guilds you want to limit the command to.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed in any of the listed guilds.

description: `$onlyForIDs` will check if the command was executed by any user of the listed user IDs and return a error if not.

...userIds.description: Users you want to limit the command to.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed by and of the listed users.

description: `$onlyForRoles` will check if the user who executed the command has any of the listed roles and return a error messageif not.

...roleIds.description: Roles you want to limit the command to.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed by any user with the listed roles.

description: `$onlyIf` will check for a condition and return a error message if that condition does not match.

error.description: Error to return when condition does not match.

description: `$onlyIfMessageContains` will check if the message contains the given text and if not return a error message.

content.description: Message which should contain the given text.

text.description: Text to check for in the message.

description: `$onlyNSFW` will check if the command was executed in a NSFW channel and return a error message if not.

error.description: Error to return when the command was not executed in a NSFW channel.

description: `$onlyPerms` will check if the user has the listed permission and return a error message if not.

error.description: Error to return when the user has not the listed permissions.

description: `$parseDate` $parseDate will return the date/time for the given milliseconds

ms.description: Time in ms you want to parse.

type?.description: The type in which the parsed date will be returned in.

description: `$parseTime` will convert any human time to milliseconds.

time.description: The time that will be converted to `ms`.

description: `$partial` checks if the object structure is partial.
`$ram` will return the RAM usage of your bot.
`$random` will generate a random number between your chosen span.

[random?](#advanced-example).description: If the returned number will be random.

description: `$randomChannelID` will return a random channel ID of all guilds or of a specific guild.
`$randomEmoji` will return a random emoji ID.
`$randomRoleID` will return a random role ID of a given guild.

guildID?.description: Where it will return the random role ID from.

description: `$randomShuffle` shuffles an array randomly.
`$randomString` will generate a random string.

range.description: Range of the random generated string.

description: `$randomText` will return a random word out of the given query

text.description: Any words/sentences/letters you want to be chosen randomly.

description: `$randomUserID` will return a random username.

global/guildID?.description: Return a random user out of all guild or out of one specific guild only.

description: `$repeatMessage` will repeat the given text for given amount of times.

time.description: The amount of times the text gets repeated.

text.description: The text that will get repeated.

description: `$replaceText` will replace specific segments of text.

text.description: Text you want to modify.

replacer.description: The text that will be replaced.

times?.description: How many times `replaceTo` replaces `replacer`. / Use `-1` for the last one.

description: `$replaceTextWithRegex` will replace specific segments of text.

text.description: Text you want to modify.

reg.description: The regex that will be replaced.

description: `$resolveColor` will convert a given color to a given type.

returnAs?.description: As what the color will be returned.

...data.description: The data of the RGB or decimal color data.

description: `$resolveEmojiID` will resolve a certain emoji.
`$reverse` will reverse given text.

text.description: Text you want to reverse.

description: `$roleExists` will check if a certain role exists within a certain guild.

roleResolver.description: ID of the role you want to check if it exists.

guildID?.description: ID of the guild where the role exists.

text.description: Text to join.

description: `$splitText` will return a value of $textSplit depending on the given index.

check.description: The argument that will check if the text ends with something specific.

description: `$stringStartsWith` will check if the given argument starts with something specific.

text.description: The text that will be checked.

check.description: The argument that will check if the text starts with something specific.

description: `$tempCooldown` will create a temporary cooldown for a command.

time.description: The duration of the cooldown.

id.description: Can be user, guild, message, channel or any other ID.

from?.description: Starting point where to slice the message.

sep?.description: Separator for the text arguments.

text.description: The text to change to locale uppercase.
